*[[GetRight]] 6, a Windows Download Manager, supports Metalink (HTTP/FTP/BitTorrent).
*[[GetRight]] 6, a Windows Download Manager, supports Metalink (HTTP/FTP/BitTorrent).
*[[KGet]] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]), [[KDE]]'s native download manager, supports Metalink in [[KDE 4]].
*[[KGet]] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]), [[KDE]]'s native download manager, supports Metalink in [[KDE 4]].
â
*[http://hampus.vox.nu/metadl/ Metadl] ([[LGPL]]) is a [[NSIS]] download plugin based on [[cURL]] that supports Metalink and downloads from one URL, supports download resume, and verifies checksums. Metadl is used by [http://cutlersoftware.com/ubuntusetup/wubi/en-US/index.html Wubi], the official [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] installer for Windows.
+
*[http://hampus.vox.nu/metadl/ Metadl] ([[LGPL]]) is a [[NSIS]] download plugin based on [[cURL]] that supports Metalink and downloads from one URL, supports download resume, and verifies checksums. Metadl is used by [http://cutlersoftware.com/ubuntusetup/wubi/en-US/index.html Wubi], the official [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]] installer for Windows.
*[http://metalinks.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/metalinks/checker/metalink.py?view=markup Metalink Checker] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]) is a cross platform command line downloader written in [[Python (programming language)|Python]] that supports multi-source downloads, as well as checking mirrors listed in .metalinks.
*[http://metalinks.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/metalinks/checker/metalink.py?view=markup Metalink Checker] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]) is a cross platform command line downloader written in [[Python (programming language)|Python]] that supports multi-source downloads, as well as checking mirrors listed in .metalinks.
*[[Orbit Downloader]], a Windows Download Manager, supports Metalink (HTTP/FTP).
*[[Orbit Downloader]], a Windows Download Manager, supports Metalink (HTTP/FTP).
Line 45: Line 45:
==In use==
==In use==
â
[http://cutlersoftware.com/ubuntusetup/wubi/en-US/index.html Wubi], the planned official [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] installer for Windows, uses [http://hampus.vox.nu/metadl/ Metadl] ([[LGPL]]) to download Ubuntu [[ISO image|ISO images]] and takes advantage of Metalink's features of higher availability and increased reliability. If there are errors in the download, they are repaired, instead of restarting the large download.
+
[http://cutlersoftware.com/ubuntusetup/wubi/en-US/index.html Wubi], the planned official [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]] installer for Windows, uses [http://hampus.vox.nu/metadl/ Metadl] ([[LGPL]]) to download Ubuntu [[ISO image|ISO images]] and takes advantage of Metalink's features of higher availability and increased reliability. If there are errors in the download, they are repaired, instead of restarting the large download.
[http://www.nabber.org/projects/appupdater/ Appupdater] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]) for Windows "is similar to apt-get or yum on Linux. It automates the process of installing and maintaining up to date versions of programs."
[http://www.nabber.org/projects/appupdater/ Appupdater] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]) for Windows "is similar to apt-get or yum on Linux. It automates the process of installing and maintaining up to date versions of programs."
Line 53: Line 53:
Currently, [[OpenOffice.org]] uses Metalinks to distribute their free office suite. [[cURL]] offers Metalinks of their downloads. [[UniProt]] Consortium also provides a Metalink for their large protein database. [[Dofus]], a Flash [[MMORPG]] uses Metalinks for downloads.
Currently, [[OpenOffice.org]] uses Metalinks to distribute their free office suite. [[cURL]] offers Metalinks of their downloads. [[UniProt]] Consortium also provides a Metalink for their large protein database. [[Dofus]], a Flash [[MMORPG]] uses Metalinks for downloads.
â
The following distributions use Metalink for [[ISO image]] distribution: [[Arch Linux]], [[BeleniX]], [[Berry Linux]], [[BLAG Linux and GNU]], [[Damn Small Linux]], [[DesktopBSD]], [[KateOS]], [[Linux Mint]], [[openSUSE]], [[PC-BSD]], [[Pardus (operating system)|Pardus Linux]], [[PuppyLinux]], redWall Firewall, [[Sabayon Linux]], StartCom Enterprise Linux, [[SUSE Linux]], [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], [[Ubuntu Christian Edition]].
+
The following distributions use Metalink for [[ISO image]] distribution: [[Arch Linux]], [[BeleniX]], [[Berry Linux]], [[BLAG Linux and GNU]], [[Damn Small Linux]], [[DesktopBSD]], [[KateOS]], [[Linux Mint]], [[openSUSE]], [[PC-BSD]], [[Pardus (operating system)|Pardus Linux]], [[PuppyLinux]], redWall Firewall, [[Sabayon Linux]], StartCom Enterprise Linux, [[SUSE Linux]], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]], [[Ubuntu Christian Edition]].
